Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a class that provides UDP-based network communication for device discovery and identity exchange in a local area network (LAN) environment, supporting both server (listener) and client (broadcaster) functionalities.

Class Description: LanLinkProvider is a class that handles UDP communication for device discovery in a LAN. It listens for identity broadcasts from other devices and broadcasts its own identity. It manages socket creation, packet handling, and network trust verification.

Attributes:
- context: [Context] - Android context for accessing device information and preferences
- udpServer: [DatagramSocket] - UDP socket for receiving broadcast packets
- listening: [boolean] - Flag indicating whether the UDP listener is active
- UDP_PORT: [static final int] - Default UDP port for communication (1716)
- MIN_PORT: [static final int] - Minimum valid TCP port number (1716)
- MAX_UDP_PACKET_SIZE: [static final int] - Maximum size of UDP packets (512KB)

Methods:
- setupUdpListener() -> [void] - Sets up and starts a UDP listener thread that continuously receives packets
- udpPacketReceived(DatagramPacket packet) -> [void] - Processes received UDP packets containing device identity information
- sendUdpIdentityPacket(List<InetAddress> ipList, @Nullable Network network) -> [void] - Broadcasts device identity to specified IP addresses
- configureSocket(Socket socket) -> [void] - Configures socket settings (keep-alive)
- isDeviceTrusted(String deviceId) -> [boolean] - Checks if a device is marked as trusted in shared preferences
- onStart() -> [void] - Starts the UDP listener
- onStop() -> [void] - Stops the UDP listener and cleans up resources
